author: Lee S.

description:
This lovely restaurant in Noe Valley gets FIVE stars for its food.  We had a selection of tapas (calamari, small gem salad, anchovies, croquetas de rabo de toro -- oxtail), jamon serrano, basque sausage/escarole flatbread, the pork belly (crispy/fatty/salty/wonderful), and the steelhead.  All were superb.  Delicious!  The sauce on the calamari was exquisite.

They were quite gracious about making room for our toddler (though it's clear that despite its Noe Valley location, it's not the most child-suited -- there were, however three infants in the restaurant when we were there).   

Re: Service -- once we were seated it was good.  There were no posted hours on the door, so we walked in when we thought it was open (at 5) and were ignored (one female server walked past us three times without acknowledging our presence) for 10 minutes at which point we asked someone behind the counter if they were still closed  (answer: yes) and then went  for a walk for 15 minutes. However once the hostess was there, she was very accommodating.  Our server was friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive (and he made very good recommendations to suit our tastes).

The deliciousness of the food and the subsequent great service and the fact that they have only been officially open for 2 days helped us to forgive the earlier service faux pas and elevates our overall rating to a five.  So glad to have this new addition to our neighborhood and city!
author: A S.

description: I loved the sharing of dishes; it really lets you experience all the flavors that they have to offer. delicious everything, but to my sweet tooth, the cake was interesting, but a little dull.
author: Mary C.

description: excellent space for tapas and a chill evening! service was fantastic and the food and wine no less! request for a table in the heated garden patio (much more quiet and fun). loved the cauliflower medjool dates (dont order if u dont like cauliflower), and the cheese plate! Be sure to get the muscat cava (it is not syrupy sweet but just floral and delicate)! the patatas bravas are classic of course but my only advice to not serve whole baby potatoes (but chop them up as we've had in spain). Fun and really wonderful evening! Will def be back!
author: sue c.

description:
Contigo is a such comfortable yet vibrant restaurant, that I always have it in mind as one of my top picks in San Francisco. I decided to take my parents for my birthday dinner on a Saturday night. I was concerned it could be a little loud for them since it is a small space, and the last time I ate here it was noisily buzzing (in a good way!).  But luckily that night seemed to be "date night", meaning there were quiet couples everywhere. Therefore, Contigo is lively enough for a group out for drinks and tapas, yet small enough for an intimate party of 2 or 3 diners.
I love the first moment of walking into the restaurant and seeing the line of (extremely hot) chefs all diligently putting together dishes. Seems like a dream job with the open kitchen. The kitchen is so rustic with the open oven and all the hanging copper pans. The extremely nice hostess took us to our seat outside, which was nice if you are looking for a quieter noise level. It was really nostalgic of eating outside in my home garden, especially with all the garden plants growing in the small boxes. 
Service was only okay because we seemed to be a last table seated during out hostess' shift, so she seemed tired, and I understand how that can be, but it was a tad uncomfortable. 
I always get excited about the seasonal flatbreads here. The manchego cheese and summer squash was sooo good. Sardines with avocado on toast are a must here........ we ordered two.....! Make sure to get a side of Patas Bravas with traditional Romesco sauce to share as well. 
I think the best way to order is to share everything, and the tapas were much more memorable than the main courses, especially because it's all about the sharing, and sharing makes the meal more enjoyable. 
I think I will keep returning to Contigo, for the food... annnnd also to see the line of chefs again!
author: Alexandra a.

description: From the moment they opened, we have loved this neighborhood place: a sweet back patio where they grow produce and herbs, and recycled and sustainable renovation create a really pleasant ambiance. The service is friendly, and the food great. Favorites are pa amb tomaquet, albondigas, and anchovies on toast with avocado. Their flatbreads are amazing, and they have great meats and an awesome cheese plate.
author: Irene B.

description: Fantasic tapas and a great, knowledgeable waiter to boot.  Yummy jamon, cheese and drinks.
author: Danielle B.

description: I wouldn't know about the food because I walked out before being seated.  In this town, you betta have great service and this place needs to address this serious problem!  We were standing waiting for +5 minutes before the host even acknowledged us.  We were willing to sit at the bar, but he mumbled something about he would rather sit us at a table and it would only be a moment.  He disappeared....  There's a lot of staff walking around but no one is taking charge.  After another 10 minutes of waiting with no sign of the guy who spoke to us, and still open spaces at the bar, we opted for our favorite sushi near by.  If this keeps up, they will be a faint memory like so many others in this foodie town.  Tootles.
author: bill l.

description: I had heard great things about Contigo's menu and was looking forward to trying it with a bunch of 10 friends. However, the restaurant would not accept our reservation - they will only take reservations for parties of up to 8 people. In a city where restaurants are doing well if they are still open after 18 months, I am surprised that they wouldn't jump at the chance to take a booking for a larger group. They missed out on a good tab/tip and made me yelp!
author: Lisa E.

description: Ok, I feel like I am not reviewing the same place everyone else on yelp wrote about. I hate writing negative reviews about new places, but I'm so disappointed that I feel I have to. My friends and I went here tonight and we were all very, very disappointed. Yes, the interior was tastefully designed, as everyone commented, but the food (in all of our opinions), as well as the service, was seriously lacking. To begin with, the mushrooms were soggy and tasted *terrible* (as evidenced by the entire plate that we left). There was absolutely no taste - among the kinder descriptions, we said it tasted as if you were eating something when you have a cold and can taste nothing....The patatas bravas were tasty, but they were incredibly stingy on the red sauce (which is such a key part!). The other veggies were ok, but the portions were so small that we all left STARVING...in spite of a bill of $120!! So completely overpriced for the size and value! To top it all off, they did everything but ask us to leave once we had paid our bill, in spite of the fact that we hadn't yet finished our wine. Overall, we were very unimpressed. I've been to Barcelona numerous times, and this doesn't come close. I realize there aren't a lot of options in Noe, but, really, skip this place, there are plenty of other yummy spanish places in the city!
author: SL N.

description: I love this place!  I have taken friends there many tims and everyone loved it too.  The Calamari la Planxa sits on a bed of Spanish rice which absorb the juice and flavor from the calamari.  The roasted sardine is one of my favorites.  It's served with creme of avocado and mayo.  They go together so incredibly well.  I would also recommend the argula salad and the tripe.
author: Nancy L.

description: What a great little place.  The appetizers make a full meal in themselves.  The Spanish wines and cava are delicious.  You will not be disappointed, even if you've just returned from Barcelona.
author: gary h.

description: Niece was home for the holidays and we got to talking about eating our way through Spain (my fantasy) while we got lost in the Castro...and there Contigo was.  She'd read a blog by some guy she often agrees with about Contigo so of course we had to go.   We ordered a lot of food.  The salads, fish/seafood and mostly veggie dishes were the best.  I thought the anchovies were overpriced and were not anything special (I've had homemade anchovies elsewhere and they are great).  I thought the tripe, pork belly and frito polo was a little bland (beans with the pork were delicious though) and probably should have been served earlier in the meal because by the time these meat dishes were served (last), we'd already eaten everything else and were pretty full.  Note, all the food is grown locally so it's not going to be exactly like what you get in Spain.  O, but the rest of the food is so nicely flavored and tasty.  I wish they had another branch either close to my work (close to the Ferry Bldg) or out in my neighborhood so I could go more often.
author: Kai T.

description: I've been wanting to come here since this place opened and when I had family in town we picked Contigo for one of our dinners out. It was a great choice for the group as it's a tapas style restaurant which is obviously perfect for sharing. We got the traditional bread rubbed with tomato and garlic, it was so good and brought me right back to Barcelona, also got the sardines, as Rachel Zoe would say (I happen to be watch TRZP right now) I DIE. I love me a good sardine. Mmmmmmmm. The best dish of the night for me was a toss up between the greens sauteed with pine nuts and golden raisins and the pork belly bocadillo with pickled onions and chips. Get both, you will not be disappointed. The greens are tender, delicious with bits of sweetness from the raisins, it will make you feel less guilty about eating the bocadillo which is decadent, fatty, porky heaven. I am definitely going to come back here with more groups. Love!
author: Cathy T.

description: the restaurant itself is so nice inside. the meatballs were great and everything else was decent.  service was great.  but i prob wouldn't trek to noe valley just to come here.  if i was in the hood, i'd go again.  but it was just a smidgen pricey for what it was.  the churros weren't that good.  but the hot chocolate they came with was amazing.  oh and the arbequina olive oil they used is amazing too.  i went and bought a bottle the next day.
author: a g.

description: Not a tapas fan but the couple racing in past us while we read the menu raved so much we decided to try it. Contigo has to be one of the top places we've eaten all year and by the full tables in a tight economy, a "hit" and welcome addition to the Noe Valley dining choices. The food was exquisite both in flavor and presentation. Many selections to dazzle your tastebuds. Though reluctant we opted to try the calamari. It was wonderful! The staff can help you wade through the unfamiliar wine list. Service was steady and gracious for us. The prices seem appropriate to what you are getting, which is a unique dining experience. Maybe the owners will seize one of the many vacant Noe Valley storefronts to expand their winning formula. And while I have an aversion to noisy places, this really didn't seem to be intolerable. Will be going back and recommending to all my friends.
author: Coleen M.

description: Went the other night with a good friend.  Love the atmosphere in the place, the staff was awesome, friendly and helpful, the food solidly good.  My one BIG complaint was the size of their by the glass pours.  Their wine list for by the glass is not inexpensive and the pours...well...TINY!  It sorta ruined our experience as we were paying $14 a glass.  Highly recommend when you go (and do go food totally worth it) to order a bottle even if you are just two.
author: kiki m.

description: It was my first time visiting this cute tapa settlement in Noe Valley after walking by it many times. I came out rather disappointed, and surprised with the yelp review. Overall, the best dish I had was the bread with the cured meat, which required no cooking. The other dishes that I had was overly flavored, either with excessive sauce or salt. The essense of the food was gone. Well, the wine recommended by the waiter was good. But I definitely wasn't wowed. Will I go back? Probably not.
author: J J.

description: Dreeeeaaaaaamy.  Absolutely dreamy.  I am a pseudo foody who is always trying new restaurants and it has been a while since I have had an experience like this.  The service was great!  I just love new restaurants, particularly because people are still really nice and excited you are there.  The food, amazing.  I was perfectly full with enough room for TWO desserts...um what....Blue Bottle Coffee Ice Cream....for the love...it was heaven....AND churros y chocolate!!! It was like being in Spain!  We had a great low cost spanish wine, which it's always nice when restaurants take special effort in choosing good cheap wine and not just have a cheap option for the hell of it.  Seriously, I can't remember the last time my bottle of wine lasted the whole meal.  Normally restaurants rush you so quickly that there still half a bottle by the end (and I love me some wine). My favorite part, was that the dinner took two hours.  No one was rushing us, trying to turn our table, slamming the tapas out faster than you could eat them - everything was perfectly timed.  Needless to say, this restaurant has the whole package - check it out!
author: Christie A.

description: While the entire restaurant is a bit crowded the food here is amazing!  Must try the oxtail!
author: Emily H.

description: After living in Noe Valley for 15 years I have finally found a favorite spot.  Contigo is the place to go--just the two of you or a group of friends.  Having been there now five times plus and not one bad choice to date.  The wine list is unique and within price range.  Be open minded and truly give it a try--you won't be disappointed.
author: Susan R.

description: I've been craving some authentic savory tapas since returning from St. Sebastian--if you want authentic, this is the place!!  I have told everyone I know about the jamon serrano and oxtail croquettes.  And I would love to go back and make an entire meal out of those meatballs.  But, why, oh why will you not take a reservation, Contigo??!!  Sometimes, a girl just wants a sure thing.
author: Janet G.

description: This place is heavenly.  The food was fabulous, the wines superb, and the wait staff very helpful.  I went there twice during a recent SF visit.  My only dissappointment was the dessert I had each time.  No worries, though, the rest of meal surpassed expection.
author: Susan M.

description: Nice environs, creative food, good wine and reasonable prices. I can't wait to return.  One of my friends who lives near the restaurant felt the service was lacking.  I didn't find this to be the case.  Given the prices and size of the crowd I thought the service was at least above average.
author: J. O.

description: A friend recommended Contigo. She said it was the new place that was getting RAVE reviews. Now I know why! We had the best food and super friendly service. The restaurant has been open for 5 months now and they are doing everything right. The decor is hip and I even enjoyed the map in the bathroom. We ordered the Organic Heirloom Berkshire Prosciutto. My 7 year old son loved it so much we ordered a second round. My favorite item was the Coca (Flatbread) with summer squash. I could eat that everyday. We fought for the last piece. The Patatas Bravas and the Moorish Chicken were also delicious. We all ordered desert and I was overly happy with the Chocolate Caliente con Churros! My son enjoyed the house made sorbets. His favorite was the blackberry sorbet. My husband enjoyed the Blue Bottle Coffee, which was French pressed. I really appreciated that  a lot of the food was local and organic. Not to mention that they even make their own Churros! If you can, ask for Javi from Barcelona. He was the friendliest waiter I have had in a long time. I am so going back to Contigo. Gracias!
author: chris n.

description: Relax and chill atmosphere.  The Patata Brava is great, and the oxtail croquetas is good too.   Actually enjoyed the tripe w/ chorizo.  All in all a good night out.
author: Adrian L.

description: Overall,  a bit disappointing.  We tried it twice to give it the benefit of the doubt but I may not go again.  I found the food to be pretty good although the selection was small, the flat breads over priced, and the service was hit or miss.  It is not a place to grab a quick bite so expect it to take a while.  The decor, the patio and the wine list are really nice.
author: Lindsay C.

description: I like some of their drinks also service was very good but some of waiters were lack of knowledge on the menu. I am not familiar with Tapas and Cava so I asked so many questions about the food that i was going to order and my waiter was irritated by me. Also amount of food is so small for the money that I paid. I even spent $150 for two but I was still hungry so we moved to Hamano Sushi which is located right next door.  i wont go back there again because the money was not worthy in this place and food was ok.
author: June P.

description: Great restaurant. Amazing food. Cool vibe. SF eating at its finest. Try to get a table outside.
author: Marie D.

description: Visited here last night and loved it. The service was great and the food was really good.  Especially like the tortilla with nettles and the hot chocolate with churros.  So worth a visit.  They don't take reservations, so hit it on a weekday at 6:30 to be seated immediately.
author: Jane M.

description: Had a great dinner and just a great experience all-around.  Service was excellent, and the food was really exceptional.  We'll definitely be return customers.
author: carolyn h.

description:
Welcome to the neighborhood Contigo!!!  As a Noe resident, I am always surprised at how limited the good food options are in the 'hood.  Contigo is a welcome addition.  We went with some friends tonight & were pleasantly surprised at the quality of food and service.  Below is a recap of what dishes we had:

*Anchoas del Cantabrico:  Anchovies - nice & salty
* Calamares al la Plancha: Squid with Harissa - a really tasty dish, highly recommend it.  The squid is cooked perfectly and the harissa gives it that extra kick.
* Rejomon: Salted cod citrus salad - overall a disappointment.  It fot a lot of rave reviews on the site, and I was really expecting to be wowed but was not.  The salt cod was over powered by the dressing and citrus.
* Croquetas del Rabo de Toro: Beef (ox tail) fritter - absolutely delicious & a must.  When I read the description was unsure, but our waiter highly recommended this tasty deep fried ball of deliciousness.  
* Patatas a la Riojana: stewed potatoes with chorizo - another winner, the potatoes soak up the flavor of the chorizo
* Bikini: grilled cheese and ham - who doesn't like a hot sandwich.
* Jamon Iberico de Bellota - so this is the $31 ham, tasty.  Glad I tried it since I have read so much about it.  Very good, but unless you are are BIG foodie - the Serrano would be just as good
* Coca del Alachofas - OK - my friends really liked it more than me
* Pork belly with ears & feet - delicious and the beans are AMAZING.

For dessert we had the churros with the chocolate sauce - just OK.  We also had the cheese sampler - the cheeses were terrific.

Overall - the next visit - I am definitely getting the beef croquette, the stewed potatoes, pork belly, and squid again.  This place is definitely worth another visit.

Bon appetit!
author: P W.

description: good wine, good food, really good staff (i had the blondish spanish guy last time i was in, very cool/helpful) and close to my house. what more could a guy ask for in a restaurant?
author: G. John E.

description: The service was very good. Prompt and well timed. Our waitress was very knowledgable about the offerings.  I'm glad we got to sit on the patio because the restaurant seemed to lack atmosphere. Very modern, clean, simple, bright setting with high ceilings and concrete floors. The food was fine.   It is what I would call "california" tapas.  Everything arrived on small plates, true, but it seemed to lack alot of the spanish, basque and catalonian flavors and styles that I expected from a tapas restaurant named Contigo. Had a REALLY interesting white wine that taste and smelled like blue cheese (in a good way). The "flatbread" was basically just a thin crust pizza and the salads were decent.  Nothing to complain about, but nothing to get excitied about either.  The experience just kind of washed over me.  If you are impressed by a $36 cured meats appetizer that was sliced  from a vegan pig that was feed acorns and evian water, then aged for 36 years at at 45 degree angle .... Contigo is a safe bet. If you want some really rich flavorful traditional spanish tapas in a warm seductive environment go to Ilune Basque in North Beach
author: Paul S.

description: I can't believe it took us this long to experience Contigo.  "Experience" is the right word - far more than just eating incredibly delicious, interesting food, we enjoyed a full dining event last night at Contigo.  We started with a few small plate selections (the croquetas and the calamar were my favorites), complemented by a delicious cava.  Next round of food included the delicious flatbread w/ green garlic and fava leaves, the lamb tagine (one of the best I've ever had), and the spot-on chicken, washed down with a perfect tinto.  We finished off the meal with an amazingly powerful cheese plate, two types of helado (blue bottle coffee and the vanilla with to-die-for sherry), strawberry meringue yumminess, and, claro, the ridiculous churros con chocolate.  Add in the professional service and warm welcome at the front of the house, and you get a perfect evening.  We can't wait to come back!
author: Heather C.

description: ok....i've lived in noe for almost 20 years and always like to support my local businesses. so we went there tonight and had a REALLY bad experience...mainly with the host, Devin. as we all know, they do not take reservations unless it is for large parties . i can accept that. what i cannot accept is the host, devin, lying to us. we walked in and there was an open 4 top table. he told us it was being held to be combined with another table for a larger party coming in within the hour. he told us the next table would be available in an hour. at his suggestion, we gave devin our cell number to call us when a table would be available. never got a call! so we showed up an hour later to find the previously available 4 top occupied with....four people. HUH? so i know most people woulda been pissed and left...but i wanted to see how this was gonna play out. we waited another 1/2 hour, finally got a table and the food was... just ok...didn't live up to the hype and it's NOT gonna be good enough to come back a second time. i thought the service was great...alisa totally went out of her way to take care of us before we got a table...so come to find out that they were holding that 4 top table for Devin's parents. ok...i know you don't take reservations... but if you tell us the table is being help for your family, i can accept that...but to LIE and then not call us and to add insult to hunger, they seat another party of 4 before us (i'm pretty sure we were there before them!!)...DUDE!! are you kidding me!! service was great but totally left a bitter taste and i will not be going back....and if it were me, i woulda comped us at least a dish...but no such courtesy...try andalu or piqueos for tapas...one guys opinion!
author: Chris M.
